channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2024120780
item.description:
Report X-2024120780

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-17T12:31:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated that while at a customer location, he noticed the commodity had fallen over during transit due to the pallet breaking, resulting in the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024120779
item.description:
Report X-2024120779

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-17T12:31:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operation. The UN 1A2 steel drum (Overpack, shrink wrapped on a wooden pallet) fell off of the belt, damaging the top/lid of the drum. Markings and labels on the drum: 19kg, LOT#BA3374SV, UC/61302-7 UVETT Adhesion Primer, EJ Full VOLYM Part Full Container, Overpack XRY/OK/GOT/3227/ 2024-12-10T18:12 The steel drum was placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.
